summary: This is an internal DOJ email chain from July 24, 2019, discussing Jeffrey Epstein's reported suicide attempt in jail. It shows prosecutors coordinating with public affairs and noting defense counsel's delayed response to a meeting request.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; reported to have attempted to hang himself while in custody.

events.title: Reported Epstein suicide attempt
events.description: ABC News reports that Jeffrey Epstein tried to hang himself while in custody.

events.title: Prosecution team call with defense counsel
events.description: The prosecution team schedules a call with Epstein's defense counsel for 3 PM, noting the defense asked for a later time when the prosecution requested a call first thing in the morning.

keyFacts: On July 24, 2019, ABC News reported that Jeffrey Epstein had attempted to hang himself in jail.
The email shows internal DOJ coordination on how to respond to the suicide attempt report, with one official inclined to 'push back' on it.
The prosecution team noted that when they requested a call with defense counsel first thing in the morning, the defense asked to schedule it for later in the day (3 PM).
